txt.en: You have defeated Ozût, Reinn's killer, but this investigation is not yet over...
Reinn is dead... and his killer is near!
You have avenged poor Reinn... and you notice that you have an audience
Reinn never made it to the Twenty-first Hall to deliver his news to Mögr. With the dangers of Zelem-melek upon his path, you cannot help but worry for him.

'If you are worried... perhaps I should be as well. I hope you find Reinn and send him back. I do miss the foolhardy fellow.

'I promise I will do better and listen to him. I believe that he was not wholly wrong to be so guarded.

'Please return with Reinn, [placeholder]!'
Reinn tried to get to the Twenty-first Hall from the Great Hall of Durin.\n\nYou should backtrack from the Twenty-first Hall and search for Reinn, heading south and taking a right along the passage.

'I wish I had followed you at once, [placeholder], but by the time I realized it, you were already gone, for you are braver and better than I.

'Poor Reinn! I was cruel to send him away, and he died to bring me wisdom that I was eager to ignore. Only you did right by him, for you avenged him.

'I will honour his memory in the Twenty-first Hall always, and we will never let down our guard again. It was folly! Madness!'
Ozût mentioned another Orc involved in Reinn's death.\n\nYou should search the passages to the Great Hall of Durin for clues to Khîl's whereabouts.
It is likely that Khîl made his way to the high platform overlooking the centre of the Great Hall of Durin.\n\nYou should search the high platform for another sign of Khîl.
Mögr has followed you to this spot, and stands nearby in silence.\n\nYou should speak with Mögr.
Found a sign that Khîl came this way ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Search the high platform for a sign of Khîl
Speak with Mögr nearby, in the Great Hall of Durin
